description:
Google's line of products and services to our clients never stops growing. The Partnerships Development team is responsible for seeking and exploring new opportunities with Google's partners. Armed with your business acumen and extensive product knowledge, you are right on the front line of interacting with our partners, and helping them find ways to grow using Google's newest product offerings. Your knowledge of relevant verticals and relationships with key industry players will help shape our great applications and content for products such as YouTube, Google TV and Commerce.

Google hopes to empower kids by enabling timely access to diverse, engaging content and helping parents to discover the best apps, books and video. The mobile partnerships team develops relationships with a range of organizations, from indies to large publishers, works with them to build great apps and find ways for them to reach their audiences and manage their digital businesses. From joint design to solving technical problems for partners and distributing apps globally, we provide the full lifecycle support for partners.

As an Strategic Partner Development Manager for Family and Educational Apps, you will use effective business judgment and extensive industry knowledge to manage, drive and build a pipeline of engaging and educational apps and games for kids.

Google Play offers music, movies, books, apps and games for your devices, powered by the cloud. It’s a Google approach to entertainment, syncing magically across your devices and on the web. As part of the Android and Mobile team, Googlers working on Google Play do everything from engineering our backend systems, to shaping the product strategy, to forming great content partnerships. They make it possible for people to do things like buy an ebook or song on their Android phone, then have it instantly available on their laptop. The Google Play team helps strengthen the overall Android ecosystem by giving developers and partners a premium store where they can reach millions of users.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 6 years of experience building and growing relationships.
  • Experience in sourcing and creating pipelines.
  • Experience managing and negotiating with partners.
  • Experience building and growing relationships.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA, Master's degree or PhD.
  • Extensive experience in, understanding of and passion for family and educational digital content, including policy, business models, sales channels and the competitive landscape.
  • Extensive experience engaging and managing mobile app developers at a large technology company and/or helping mobile apps achieve ecosystem success.
  • Experience operating within and leading cross-functional teams (e.g., Product Management, Implementation, Legal, Finance, Marketing).
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication skills to formulate and articulate technical, financial and growth ideas.
responsibilities:
• Analyze the digital market landscape for family and educational content and help mobile content developers achieve success on Google Play.
  • Increase partner engagement for Android by encouraging them to participate in early access programs, adopt key APIs and leverage opportunities to reach consumers.
  • Work with product management and other cross-functional teams to scale existing partner programs to include family and educational apps.
  • Stay up-to-date on latest developments within the family and educational content space through research, attending/speaking at events and meeting with influencers.
  • Provide feedback on features and business models to Product/Engineering teams.
title: Strategic Partner Development Manager, Education Apps and Games
